title: 1990's - present British typeface
content:
Looking for a recent british typeface, preferably sans serif. Don't want to use something like Gill Sans which has been used to death, so looking for something a little different.

Any help much appreciated
author: craigdf1o

comments.content:
Jeremy Tankard's work would be a good place to start...

[http://typography.net/](http://web.archive.org/web/20130819155650/http:/typography.net/ "http://typography.net/")

Bliss might be a little too like Gill Sans for your taste, maybe Fenland would do. Or perhaps FS Elliot.

[http://www.fontsmith.com/fonts/fs-elliot.cfm?tab=detail&](http://web.archive.org/web/20130819155650/http:/www.fontsmith.com/fonts/fs-elliot.cfm?tab=detail& "http://www.fontsmith.com/fonts/fs-elliot.cfm?tab=detail&")

Tim

Yeah i've just been looking at Bliss by Tankard, very nice typeface.

Thanks
[Priori Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20130819155650/http:/www.virusfonts.com/fonts/priori-sans) might also qualify as a "warped Gill Sans".

I like Camphor from Nick Job:  
 [http://www.linotype.com/769290/Camphor-family.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20130819155650/http:/www.linotype.com/769290/Camphor-family.html "http://www.linotype.com/769290/Camphor-family.html")

P22 Underground Pro Set  
Nice alternative characters and diamond tittles!  
 [http://www.youworkforthem.com/font/T0515/p22-underground-pro-set](http://web.archive.org/web/20130819155650/http:/www.youworkforthem.com/font/T0515/p22-underground-pro-set "http://www.youworkforthem.com/font/T0515/p22-underground-pro-set")
I like David Quay’s Kade, but it is clearly a display face.

What are your criteria for British? --  
Country of birth of designer?  
Citizenship of designer?  
Residence of designer?  
Where the typeface was designed?  
Country of publishing foundry?  
Recognizable British look or design issues addressed by the face?

Please weight these criteria according to importance.
